meanings.sent1: She can outdance all her friends at the school dance.
meanings.sent2: During the dance-off, Sarah managed to outdance everyone else.
meanings.sent3: The little girl tried to outdance her reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful moves seemed to outdance the music itself.
meanings.sent5: With each step, she continued to outdance her previous performance.

meanings.definition: To outperform in a dance competition.
meanings.sent1: The professional dancer was able to outdance all the other contestants.
meanings.sent2: In the final round, Mark knew he had to outdance his rival to win.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outdance the dog in a playful dance-off.
meanings.sent4: Her energy on the dance floor could outdance anyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized team managed to outdance their opponents with ease.
